intro: Caucalis gummifera, commonly known as the gummed caucalis, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, greenish-yellow flowers that appear in umbels. The plant produces a milky, latex-like sap, which is a distinguishing feature. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils in arid or semi-arid regions. Caucalis gummifera is often found in Mediterranean climates and is adapted to survive in dry conditions.
